scripts.ftp-syst:
STAT: 
FTP server status:
     Connected to 192.168.20.1
     Logged in as ftp
     TYPE: ASCII
     No session bandwidth limit
     Session timeout in seconds is 300
     Control connection is plain text
     Data connections will be plain text
     vsFTPd 2.3.4 - secure, fast, stable
End of status

scripts.smtp-commands: metasploitable.localdomain, PIPELINING, SIZE 10240000, VRFY, ETRN, STARTTLS, ENHANCEDSTATUSCODES, 8BITMIME, DSN,
scripts.ssl-cert:
Subject: commonName=ubuntu804-base.localdomain/organizationName=OCOSA/stateOrProvinceName=There is no such thing outside US/countryName=XX
Not valid before: 2010-03-17T14:07:45
Not valid after:  2010-04-16T14:07:45
scripts.sslv2:
SSLv2 supported
  ciphers: 
    SSL2_RC2_128_CBC_EXPORT40_WITH_MD5
    SSL2_DES_64_CBC_WITH_MD5
    SSL2_DES_192_EDE3_CBC_WITH_MD5
    SSL2_RC4_128_EXPORT40_WITH_MD5
    SSL2_RC2_128_CBC_WITH_MD5
    SSL2_RC4_128_WITH_MD5

reasons: Script flags: weak_ssl_ciphers, cert_issue, ssl_date_skew, sslv2_supported, weak_ssl_ciphers

scripts.mysql-info:
Protocol: 10
  Version: 5.0.51a-3ubuntu5
  Thread ID: 11
  Capabilities flags: 43564
  Some Capabilities: Support41Auth, SupportsCompression, ConnectWithDatabase, LongColumnFlag, Speaks41ProtocolNew, SupportsTransactions, SwitchToSSLAfterHandshake
  Status: Autocommit
  Salt: 1]aNEO<!,[dfQDAVpOy8

users: 1

  lusers: 1

  version: Unreal3.2.8.1. irc.Metasploitable.LAN 
  uptime: 0 days, 0:41:46
  source ident: nmap

scripts.ajp-methods: Failed to get a valid response for the OPTION request

mitre_attack.name: Web Service
playbook: Limit external connections, inspect for exfiltration over HTTP/HTTPS.
Detect: review outbound connections to odd domains or high-volume hosts.
Remediate: restrict network egress and implement proxy/inspection.

mitre_attack.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
playbook: Confirm vulnerable application endpoints and review public exploits or PoCs.
Contain: apply WAF rules and rate-limit suspicious input patterns.
Remediate: patch application or fix vulnerable code paths; sanitize inputs.
Detect: enable webserver logging, monitor for anomalous POST/GET payloads and 500s.
Verify: use non-intrusive checks and code review to validate fix.

top_reasons: Script flags: weak_ssl_ciphers, cert_issue, ssl_date_skew, sslv2_supported, weak_ssl_ciphers

mitre_attack.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
playbook: Confirm vulnerable application endpoints and review public exploits or PoCs.
Contain: apply WAF rules and rate-limit suspicious input patterns.
Remediate: patch application or fix vulnerable code paths; sanitize inputs.
Detect: enable webserver logging, monitor for anomalous POST/GET payloads and 500s.
Verify: use non-intrusive checks and code review to validate fix.

mitre_attack.name: Network Sniffing
playbook: Eliminate cleartext protocols (replace telnet/plain FTP with SSH/SFTP).
Detect: inspect network taps for large numbers of plaintext credentials.
Remediate: enforce encryption, apply ACLs to limit management interfaces.

mitre_attack.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
playbook: Identify affected service binary and version; confirm exploitability via vendor advisories.
Contain: isolate host from network segments, apply firewall rules to block offending ports.
Remediate: apply vendor patch or upgrade to a non-affected version.
Detect: enable EDR rules to catch abnormal child processes and suspicious commands.
Verify: run non-destructive scans and compare process trees before/after tests.

actions.title: Ensure written authorization
actions.details: Confirm you have written permission to perform further testing on this host.

mitre_attack.name: Web Service
playbook: Limit external connections, inspect for exfiltration over HTTP/HTTPS.
Detect: review outbound connections to odd domains or high-volume hosts.
Remediate: restrict network egress and implement proxy/inspection.

actions.title: Collect non-intrusive evidence
actions.details: Collect banners, TLS ciphers, SSH KEX/cipher lists and service configs using non-destructive methods. Document everything for the owner.

actions.details: If anonymous FTP is not required, disable anonymous logins. If required, restrict to chrooted directories and logging.

Detect: enable EDR rules to catch abnormal child processes and suspicious commands.
Verify: run non-destructive scans and compare process trees before/after tests.

actions.title: Enable monitoring and alerting
actions.details: Ensure auth/logging is in place and that alerts are generated for suspicious activity or crashes.

mitre_attack.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
playbook: Identify affected service binary and version; confirm exploitability via vendor advisories.
Contain: isolate host from network segments, apply firewall rules to block offending ports.
Remediate: apply vendor patch or upgrade to a non-affected version.
Detect: enable EDR rules to catch abnormal child processes and suspicious commands.
Verify: run non-destructive scans and compare process trees before/after tests.

actions.title: Collect non-intrusive evidence
actions.details: Collect banners, TLS ciphers, SSH KEX/cipher lists and service configs using non-destructive methods. Document everything for the owner.

actions.title: Verify reported version
actions.details: Validate the banner with multiple probes (nmap -sV, service-specific safe queries). Banners can be faked.
